title: Tower damage
body: Towers don't do enough damage early game, diving is way too easy at the moment. I play Garen a lot and I just stroll under towers and kill people. Tower diving should be a skill which needs perfecting, its just frustrating when you get dove so early into a game.

replies.body: This game has been out for 8 seasons, excluding the beta and alpha stages, I think we had more than enough time perfecting tower dives. Just go look at season 3 and before tower dives compared to now and spot the difference not in the tower damage, but how it's played. It's complete crap compared to today

The problem with towers dealing high up front damage is that it greatly impacts the power of hook supports that can drag people under tower, particularly in the early game and particularly at low elo.

If you increase tower damage even a little, iBlitzcrank will spike in winrates on Smurfs.
How about increase their scaling as the game progresses? The don't scale nearly as well as champions or jungle monsters or even minions.

The entire point of champions gaining armor per level is so that champions are more capable of diving towers later in the game. Towers are not meant to be a serious threat after 15 minutes, they are an objective for you to kill. Riot wants teams to defend towers, not for towers to defend champions.

More like assassins and fighters can towerdive without concern; assassns can shrug off aggro with intangibility and mobility, while fighters just lifesteal their opponent to death or shield through it.  I've seen a few squishy supports towerdive early on because they can similarly get away with it.

Not only that, but champions that waveclear well become really strong because they will be under way less threat of a dive.

Edit: And we know how those games turn out. Just 50 minutes of people clearing waves.
